content:
Is this a Pop or Imap mail account? Are you stuck redownloading the same email, so no new emails ?

I've come across this sort of problem before but it usually occurs in a POP mail account. Sometimes an email gets stuck like a log jam on server. Sometimes it due to an email the server put into junk/Spam.

  • Logon to your webmail account via a browser.
  • Empty the server 'Junk/Spam' folder
  • In Thunderbird, use 'Get Messages' to see if emails start coming in properly.
  • If still no joy...back in the webmail account look in the Inbox for the email that keeps repeatly being downloaded to Thunderbird and delete it.
  • In Thunderbird, use 'Get Messages' to see if emails start coming in properly.


You say they can be late, but Thunderbird can only download if the emails have been received on the server. If they are late getting to the server, then that is not a Thunderbird issue. The emails may been delayed at any point. To check out received times: Select email so you can read contents. Click on the 'More' button and select 'View Source' The 'Received: from' info will mention the various servers and the times received by each sever. The one at the top being the last server which has your account - the one nearer to the 'FROM, TO, Subject headers will be the oldest/first server which would tell you when it was first sent. Please note if email is being passed around various continents then the times will be accurate for the location. For example: I got an email from someone in Thailand Date: Sun, 5 Feb 2023 14:56:40 +0700 After sending the first server received : 04 Feb 2023 23:56:51 -0800 (PST) My server - the one at the top got email: 5 Feb 2023 07:56:51 +0000 Thunderbird converts the date/time based on my computer settings, so in Thunderbird Date header is: 5 Feb 2023 7:56AM

Although it was nearly 3pm in Thailand when it was sent, in the UK it was nearly 8am, so I actually got the email almost immediately after it was sent. But that email first went to the USA which time wise looked like it had somehow gone back in time to a previous day. Had I lived in the USA that might look weird getting emails before the day had been created :) So time and date is relative. It might look like a delay based on a Date, but it might not be in reality.
creator: Toad-Hall

Hello there We have read your message. We try to help you.

Replaced the beta version of Thunderbird with a normal version of Thunderbird.

What do you mean by erase the beta version and keep the settings? If the version is deleted you will not lose any files. The normal version that you then install will just run without anything being lost.

Settings will be lost and will need to be reset.

provided you manually uninstall the previous version. It will be different with an update.

content:
Here are the basics: to use your own domain, you need an email service provider to store the messages and provide internet access. If you compare to a car, the domain name would be the license plate allowing access to the internet, and the car would be the email service provider. Thunderbird could then serve to provide the email access and maintenance from your PC. Okay, that analogy isn't perfect, but the best I could think of quickly. Once you have the email service provider, you can set it up with Thunderbird, which is free. What you would need would be the incoming server name, the outgoing server name, and basic setup info, such as port number and authentication protocol, which the email provider would give to you. In speaking with them, you would want to be assured that their service is accessible from an email client and not just via a web service. I don't know qualify of services of any email providers, but I did notice this URL offers cheap email hosting: https://www.namecheap.com/hosting/email/ as does this one: https://www.zoho.com/workplace/ or Google's product at https://workspace.google.com/

But you may wish to use a search engine and look for "email host" as all I did was list a few examples. Neither this forum nor Mozilla takes any responsibility for what choices users make regarding domain registrars or email providers. Be aware, some sites will want to sign you up for a website host. You don't need that for just email. Good luck.

content:
I have mentioned two methods on how to get 'Local Folders' emails from a backup into the current Thunderbird. The first method is about getting a complete copy of the 'Local Folders' mail account to replace the current 'Local Folders' account. The second is how to use ImportExportTools NG addon to import mbox files from a backup.

If you simply want to replace the current 'Local Folders' mail account with a backup of 'Local Folders' mail account, you can do the following:

  • Menu icon > Help > More TRoubleshooting Information
  • Under 'Application Basics' half way - Profile Folders - click on 'Open Folder' - see image below as guide.

A new window opens showing the contents of your current profile name folder.

  • Exit Thunderbird now - this is important.
  • Click on 'Mail' folder to see contents.

You will see the 'Local Folders' folder. If you do not have anything important in the current 'Local Folders' account:

  • Move that 'Local Folders' folder to the desktop - you can delete it later when all is completed.
  • Leave this window open ready to receive the backup.

Now in a new Explorer window:

  • search for the backup called thu2021
  • I'm not sure what you saved in thu2021 but you need to locate the profile name folder and click on the 'Mail' folder to see the 'Local Folders' folder.
  • Get a copy of that 'Local Folders' folder.
  • Go the the other window which shows the contents of the current profile 'Mail' folder.
  • Paste the backup of copied 'Local Folders' folder into the 'Mail' folder - thus replacing the one you moved to the desktop.

Start Thunderbird.

Alternative if you only want to import specific files back into Local Folders because you already have some folders you need to keep.

  • Right click on 'Local Folders' mail account name in Folder Pane and select 'ImportExportTools NG'
  • Select 'Import mbox file'

If you want to only import specific mbox files then select:

  • 'Import directly one or more mbox files.

If you had folders that contained subfolders and you need to import the folder and all it's subfolders then select:

  • 'Import one or more mbox files with it's/their subdirectory'
  • click on 'OK'

A new window opens.

  • Browse to the 'thu2021' backup folder.
  • In the profile name folder click on 'Mail' folder
  • click on 'Local Folders' folder to see contents.

mbox files will have same name as the folder you would see in Thunderbird. mbox files do not have any extension. ignore the files that have a *.msf extension.

  • Select an mbox file and click on 'Open'

The mbox file containing emails gets imported into the 'Local Folders' mail account.

As a guide and example image below showing what an mbox file looks like.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: The message is stating that the domain mcintyrehomes is suspect. DKIM and SPF records are set at email host provider, so when ISPs attempt to verify legitimacy by checking sending server and find no such records, the assumption is that the message is spam. If that is your domain, I suggest you check with your email host provider.

content:
Some people recommend that to update from a very old version to the current 102, it's necessary to install all the major versions after 3, i.e. 10, 17, 24, 31... A simpler and more effective method is to install TB 102 to a separate directory, with it's own profile, and to import the address books and local mail from the old TB 3 profile to the new one. The address books are .mab files, and the mail is stored in mbox files. Importing mbox files is done by copying them into the Mail/Local Folders location of the new profile. Address books can be imported from Tools/Import.

Before making any changes or installing a new version, make a backup of the TB 3 profile folder.
creator: sfhowes

content:
It looks like your business account is sending through the smtp server associated with her account, so recipients see messages as if they were sent from her account. Set up separate smtp servers and make sure each account is sending on the smtp with a matching User Name.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1350593
creator: sfhowes

content:
First, I cannot help you fix this, but I can offer a suggestion. From your wording, you 'pasted' the profile in. For Thunderbird to work, the profile must be the one that Thunderbird expects. After it starts with one that it knows, you can then import one of your choice. My guess is the profiles.ini is not pointing to the one you pasted in. There are ways to fix that, but I suggest you take the 'easy' way out and - uninstall thunderbird - delete the thunderbird folder at c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming - reinstall thunderbird - start thunderbird and press the ALT key to bring up the menu - click tools>import>import from another thunderbird installation - select the recovered profile

If this does not work, it means there is corruption within the profile, not uncommon since you experienced problem during backup. (TIP: whenever doing backup with third-party software, be sure to NOT be running Thunderbird during the backup, as that virtually guarantees a corrupted profile.)
creator: davidsk
